body_html: Before we get this in, question about the API (@jekbradbury may want to weight in too) - layer norm doesn't need to have a known input size, since it doesn't require learnable parameters. But for the sake of consistency with most other things, should we have the layer take in a size as input, and an affine argument to disable learnable parameters? The functional interface can still take an arbitrary size (and do the checks to make sure if weights/biases are passed that they are of the correct size).

body: Before we get this in, question about the API (@jekbradbury may want to weight in too) - layer norm doesn't need to have a known input size, since it doesn't require learnable parameters. But for the sake of consistency with most other things, should we have the layer take in a size as input, and an `affine` argument to disable learnable parameters? The functional interface can still take an arbitrary size (and do the checks to make sure if weights/biases are passed that they are of the correct size).
